message: i'd like to relaunch http://androidsnippets.org. it could be such a great resource, both from code, ui and interaction on the site. It's well indexed by Google too (gets around 1k visitors a day).
it was overwhelmed by spam and i made a static copy. the code was based on djangosnippets, which was a big pile of crap.
especially appreciated would be every kind of design input (on everything from user interaction to site layout), as well as code contributions and reviews.
major points of the rewrite include (a) discoverability of snippets (b) ability to edit/improve snippets (c) user interface
Ups, wrong github url... Here is the correct one: https://github.com/metachris/androidsnippets.com
I was thinking about using Disqus for commenting, but their package that allows users to use their androidsnippets.com account is incredibly expensive

i'm also thinking about tags vs categories. tags can easily lead to having lots of tags with only one or two snippets each (if there are no good recommendations). the other option is a list of categories, which may be extensible by users. what do you think?
